data.title: You can live on the daily specials menu
data.text: High quality local food. Friendly staff. It is a bit overpriced for what it is. Typically charging what you would see in a Manhattan sandwich shop (I know, excessive if trying to lunch on a budget). But alas, there is salvation. They offer one of their delicious sandwiches with a small portion of one of their sides for $5-6 as their daily special. The sandwiches are a good size also, so you can enjoy a budget friendly lunch by having a friend join you and going splitsies.

data.title: Best breakfast in Gainesville
data.text: This is the hidden gem of Gainesville breakfast eateries. Whether your favorite breakfast food is a decked out omelette or a decadent chocolate chip pancake, Harvest Thyme does not disappoint. This restaurant has free wifi, a good atmosphere, and great people.

data.title: Gone down hill
data.text: We use to go to the one downtown and magnolia Park. The food and service has gone down. The soups are always very good. Shame that they aren't like they use to be because it is very convenient. The last two times I went they decided to close early and wouldn't take my order. I was there about an hour before they normally close and he wouldn't make me a smoothie  because he already cleaned the machine. The people who ran it before were very accommodating. The people who run the downtown restaurant also are very rude. My husband has been going there for many years but looks like owners changed or aren't on the scene anymore. Won't be going back.

data.title: Perfect place for a light lunch!
data.text: The salads are fresh and the bowls filled to overflowing. Might be easier to eat it on a large plate! LOL The sandwiches are loaded and delicious. Unpretentious atmosphere and very personable staff. A great place to meet friends for a nice, affordable lunch!

data.title: Very Good Lunch
data.text: Stopped here for lunch during a visit to the area for Business/Training. Very good food, I had the Chef Salad and Turkey and Mushroom Soup. The soup was a little disappointing, I guess I was just expecting something different. It was good - just not what I expected. The Salad made up for it, as it was very good - fresh and tasty!! Nice atmosphere, good food, comfortable little cafe.

data.title: Harvest Thyme Cafe MAGNOLIA Location is GREAT!
data.text: Very nicely prepared meals!  Eat in or have it Delivered!  Your order starts with a very nice person on the phone who takes your order (shout out to Charlie and Alex) who are always polite, quick to take the order and GET IT RIGHT every time.  I LOVE the food choices.  Range from healthy option (99% fat free yogurt, fruit cup, veggies, to the DECADENT - eg. brownies, cookies, muffin!).  Delivery if free (allowing a nicer gratuity for driver) and very FAST!  The food feels like it was prepared and packed in your mom's kitchen (that is no assembly line Fast Food feel to it).  Friendly, Fresh, Frugal and Flavorful...... EVERY TIME!  Thanks friends at Harvest Thyme Café - Magnolia location!!!!! (Hey TripAdvisor, please Add Magnolia Location as a choice to write review).

data.title: Healthy, Tasty, Clean
data.text: The service was friendly and the food was great. Wife had the Tuna with apple sandwich on gluten free bread and loved it. Daughter had the cheeseburger and was impressed. We decided that Harvest Thyme is our new Sunday lunch spot!

data.title: Cute lunch spot - very fresh
data.text: My friend and I had a nice lunch here, each of us did the half and half with soup and a salad or sandwich. You can taste and appreciate the freshness of ingredients. Also the girl taking care of us was very friendly. Good service makes a big difference in my book

data.title: Tuna Apple Melt
data.text: I didn't choose it because of top of list haha it sounds delicious and turn out it is 👍 they also use croissant for sandwich, it is good.

data.title: Great people-watching venue.
data.text: Food is good and vegetarian dishes are available.  Table are too close together and service is self-help.  Casual attire.  Great location for on foot exploring.

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text: When I was working downtown, I often ate here for lunch and always enjoyed the food. I usually got the hummus wrap and a cookie.

data.title: Good spot with great choices
data.text: Healthy lunch with tons of options from sandwiches to soups and salads. The deliver is free everywhere in town. Also they have wifi (nice to study).

data.title: Fresh home made soups
data.text:
Went for the first time and everything was exceptional. Local place on 39th next to Star Bucks. 
Great pick two options soup, salad, sandwich etc

data.title: Worth a try!
data.text: Cute 'lil place downtown but difficult to find parking for those not on foot and who have just an hour for lunch. Menu offers nice alternatives... healthy soups and sandwiches, but most of the healthy choices aren't organic. The prices are too high, and I have yet to have warm, friendly service. A true hipster place, although it's often frequented by state attorneys who occupy the nearby building. The restaurant is not open on Sundays.

data.title: Cutest place!
data.text: Went here with some friends and i was very pleased by their menu. Great selections of healthy lunch items as well. Bottom line, if you're looking for a place with a great lunch AND breakfast menu that also includes healthy options, this is your place. Cute hipster atmosphere as well, perfect for downtown Gainesville.

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: We were there for a graduation. This cafe is in the downtown area. Soup and sandwiches were very tasty and not too expensive. Friendly staff.

data.title: Everything is delicious
data.text: Their soups are fantastic. I love the kickin crab soup especially. Salads, soups, wraps, and my fav is the pick 2 for lunch. All of the ingredients are fresh and the staff is really friendly. I have evern used them for catering a business luncheon. Very easy to work with at HT.

data.title: Incredible!
data.text: Incredible sandwiches, salads, wraps, and sweets! I was in town for my son's wedding and ate  here five times (I was here for six days!). This is the best deli in town! We ate so many things from the menu, I can not list them all! Everything we had was delicious, fresh, and plentiful! I think the Strawberry fields was my favorite. The prices are reasonable too. This place is easy to get in and out of with its location on a corner in the downtown area.

data.title: Better than average
data.text: Better than average sandwich and salad shop.  Many vegetarian and vegan choices along with turkey, corned beef, tuna, etc.  Very good fruit salad and excellent oatmeal raisin cookies.

data.title: New location for light lunch
data.text:
Recently opened second location of fresh food deli, near medical buildings of Magnolia Parke
off 39th Ave.  Staff still learning the ropes seem confused about procedures.  Had lunch of
Strawberry Fields Salad which was very fresh, ideal for being on a diet since it is not one
of the heartier choices.  A few chicken strips over greens, strawberry slices, grated carrot.
The price of $8.25 seems a little high but similar to chain deli prices.  Sandwiches run $6.95 to $7.95, coffee $2 and up.  Half & half combos available.  Good healthy choices.  Large percent
of their orders were to-go.
